identity.name: AeroGraph Analytics
principles: Fusion: Aviation HUD x Graph Theory x Swiss Grid
Content: Data is the hero, UI is the cockpit
Contrast: High-viz accents against deep void backgrounds

layout.grid_system: grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-12 gap-4 p-4 md:p-6

containers.card: rounded-xl bg-[#18181b] border border-[#27272a] p-6 overflow-hidden relative

buttons.primary: bg-cyan-400 text-black hover:bg-cyan-500 font-semibold rounded-md px-6 py-2 transition-all shadow-[0_0_15px_-3px_rgba(34,211,238,0.4)]
buttons.secondary: bg-transparent border border-cyan-500/30 text-cyan-400 hover:bg-cyan-950/30 rounded-md px-6 py-2 transition-all

inputs.search: bg-[#09090b] border-white/10 focus:border-cyan-500/50 focus:ring-cyan-500/20 text-slate-200 placeholder:text-slate-600 rounded-md

cards.metric: relative overflow-hidden group hover:border-cyan-500/30 transition-colors duration-300

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text is slate-200 or lighter on dark backgrounds. Use slate-400 for secondary text, never darker.

phases.name: Setup & Theme
actions: Update tailwind.config.js with custom colors (cyan, amber, zinc-950)
Update index.css with CSS variables for the Dark Analytics theme

phases.name: Layout Structure
actions: Create MainLayout component with Sidebar and Header
Implement the 'Control Room' grid layout for the dashboard

phases.name: Core Components
actions: Customize Shadcn Card, Button, Input to match 'Dark Analytics' style

phases.name: Visualization
actions: Style the graph nodes (Airports) and links (Routes) with Cyan/Amber colors
Add Cypher Query display block with syntax highlighting

universal_guidelines: DO NOT use gradients for text unless it's a very large hero title.
DO NOT use pure black (#000000) for backgrounds; use #09090b or #0f172a.
ALWAYS add data-testid to interactive elements.
Use 'JetBrains Mono' for all data values, code snippets, and query displays.
Ensure all containers with borders have internal padding (p-4 or p-6).
Use the 'dots_pattern' or 'grid_pattern' class on the main background to give it texture.
For the GraphRAG chat, use a 'chat bubble' style that looks like a terminal log or HUD readout.
instructions_to_main_agent: You are building a 'Dark Analytics' dashboard. The user wants a 'Control Room' feel. Use the provided color palette strictly. The background should be dark (Zinc 950), cards slightly lighter (Zinc 900). Use Cyan for primary actions and graph connections. Use Amber for entities and warnings. The font 'Chivo' gives the headers a technical look. 'JetBrains Mono' is crucial for the 'Cypher Query' display. Ensure the graph visualization is interactive and fits the dark theme (dark canvas, bright nodes).
